intro: Trymatococcus kamerunianus, commonly known as the Cameroon star moss, is a rare and diminutive liverwort found in specific tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Pottiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped thalli that form dense mats on rocky surfaces. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered an important indicator species for studying tropical flora.
